text: Morning <@UFTBRB3F1> - yes, this work is currently in the planning stages. This will be a significant amount of work (~6 months) so we are assessing the best way to approach this. We may look to provide as an minimum viable product (MVP) in order to verify & test some assumptions before deciding to roll this out on a wider scale.  To set expectations, any MVP is likely to be available in Q4 of this year, all being well.

elements.text: Morning

- yes, this work is currently in the planning stages. This will be a significant amount of work (~6 months) so we are assessing the best way to approach this. We may look to provide as an minimum viable product (MVP) in order to verify & test some assumptions before deciding to roll this out on a wider scale.  To set expectations, any MVP is likely to be available in Q4 of this year, all being well.

text: Hi <@U4H19D1D2> - this was on the roadmap several years ago and we got fairly close to doing it before it was de-prioritized in favor of other projects.  There was also subsequent conflict between offering this as a service and a separate historical data service post settlement.

elements.text: Hi

- this was on the roadmap several years ago and we got fairly close to doing it before it was de-prioritized in favor of other projects.  There was also subsequent conflict between offering this as a service and a separate historical data service post settlement.

text:
I assume it's now completely off the roadmap? I imagine it has an overlap with the historical data sales.

I have been thinking about adding the private graphs endpoint to bflw, will that cause any 'issues'?

elements.text:
I assume it's now completely off the roadmap? I imagine it has an overlap with the historical data sales.

text: This has been raised before and again recently, separate from this channel.  Makes sense for us do this (allow wallet transfers via API) but has previously never been in the top of 2/3 priorities when we've surveyed customers.  Also a trickier piece of work to determine upside of work vs adding new data feeds or passive delay work

elements.text: This has been raised before and again recently, separate from this channel.  Makes sense for us do this (allow wallet transfers via API) but has previously never been in the top of 2/3 priorities when we've surveyed customers.  Also a trickier piece of work to determine upside of work vs adding new data feeds or passive delay work

text: Yes, its off the roadmap, the main priorities are further feed integrations, passive bets work.  There's too much cross over with historical data sales and again, hard to determine real benefits

elements.text: Yes, its off the roadmap, the main priorities are further feed integrations, passive bets work.  There's too much cross over with historical data sales and again, hard to determine real benefits

text:
Hi:wave:  Why did you make the delay 3 seconds instead of 5, in the tennis markets?
If I understand correctly, this delay was originally done to protect those who don't sit on the court and use slower sources to get an accurate score. Now that the delay is 3 seconds, I don't have time to cancel my bids because there are some very fast guys in the market. It's very disruptive to trade.
I hope my english isn't completely bad:)

elements.text: Hi

Why did you make the delay 3 seconds instead of 5, in the tennis markets?
If I understand correctly, this delay was originally done to protect those who don't sit on the court and use slower sources to get an accurate score. Now that the delay is 3 seconds, I don't have time to cancel my bids because there are some very fast guys in the market. It's very disruptive to trade.
I hope my english isn't completely bad:)

text: The most requested feature on your API roadmap survey a few years ago was "Football Meta Data - (score, elapsed time, goals etc)" (<https://forum.developer.betfair.com/forum/developer-program/feedback-and-recommendations/25724-api-roadmap-survey>) For me, this is the only new feature that would really make a difference! Any chance this could become real?
